definition: Chi You, legendary creator of metalworking and weapons/comet
ignorant/worm
surname Chi
surname You
outstanding/particularly, especially/a fault/to express discontentment against

sentences.english: However, the Valkyrie has a die Mohun Chi really dead?
sentences.chinese: 可是具有不死魔魂的武神蚩尤真的死了么？

sentences.english: The main activities of Huangdi were in the North, which was related to the battles against Hunzhou and Chiyou.
sentences.chinese: 黄帝主要活动在北方，与抗荤粥和战蚩尤有关。

sentences.english: This is the legendary place where Chi You fought.
sentences.chinese: 这就是传说中蚩尤战斗的地方。

sentences.english: Chiyou tribes was defeated and forced to migrate to the south.
sentences.chinese: 失败的蚩尤族系被迫向南迁徙。

sentences.english: This time, lead the Yellow Emperor, to lead troops reached the Chiyou array.
sentences.chinese: 这次，黄帝身先士卒，带兵杀入蚩尤阵中。

sentences.english: According to the legend, it was Emperor Huang who invented the compass cart, which was used in the battles with Chiyou.
sentences.chinese: 相传黄帝发明指南车，并用于对蚩尤的作战。

sentences.english: Thanks to the compass, the Yellow Emperor found out where Chi You was and defeated him.
sentences.chinese: 幸亏有了罗盘，黄帝才找到了蚩尤，将他击败。

sentences.english: Chiyou as a mythical charcter had already became the image of the palace of literature.
sentences.chinese: 蚩尤作为神话人物已经移位为文学殿堂中的意象。

sentences.english: Xuanyuan Sinan exerted a decisive function in the legendary war of Yellow Emperor against Chi You.
sentences.chinese: 黄帝战蚩尤神话中轩辕司南起了决定性作用。

definition: God of Water
the Yellow Emperor, mythological emperor of China, reigned c. 2697-2597 BC
God of Fire
Dijun, Shang dynasty protector God, possibly same as legendary Emperor 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]
Fuxi or Fu Hsi, legendary Chinese emperor, trad. 2852-2738 BC, mythical creator of fishing, trapping and writing
Flame Emperors (c. 2000 BC), legendary dynasty descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
Xingtian, headless giant hero of Chinese mythology decapitated by the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
drought demon
Yu the Great (c. 21st century BC) mythical leader who tamed the floods
Xi Wangmu, Queen Mother of the West, keeper of the peaches of immortality/popularly known as 王母娘娘
God of heaven/Celestial emperor
a water goblin in Chinese mythology usually depicted as a monkey
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
Xuan Nü, a fairy in Chinese mythology
Zhuan Xu, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4], trad. reigned 2513-2435 BC
Buzhou Mountain, a mountain from Chinese legend
